definition: play (a game of) cat and mouse (with somebody) [to pretend to allow someone to do or have what they want, and then to stop them from doing or having it]

examples.text: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.

definition: to pretend to allow someone to do or have what they want, and then to stop them from doing or having it

examples.text: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.

sense.lexical_unit: play (a game of) cat and mouse (with somebody)

definition: the cat's whiskers/pyjamas [something or someone that is better than everything else]

examples.text: I really thought I looked the cat's whiskers in that dress.

definition: something or someone that is better than everything else

examples.text: I really thought I looked the cat's whiskers in that dress.

definition: not stand/have a cat in hell's chance (of doing something) [to not have any chance of succeeding]

examples.text: They don't have a cat in hell's chance of being elected.

definition: to not have any chance of succeeding

examples.text: They don't have a cat in hell's chance of being elected.

sense.lexical_unit: not stand/have a cat in hell's chance (of doing something)
